definitions: state of physical or mental inactivity with reduced responsiveness to stimulation
examples: The heat induced a pleasant torpor in the afternoon
Winter torpor helps animals conserve energy through cold months

definitions: turning or twisting force that causes rotation around an axis
rigid circular ornament worn around the neck in ancient times
examples: The mechanic applied proper torque to tighten the bolts
Electric motors generate torque to rotate the wheels
The Celtic warrior wore a golden torque around his neck
Bronze torques were discovered in the archaeological excavation

definitions: violently rushing stream of water or other liquid flowing rapidly
overwhelming outpouring or rapid transfer of digital data or information
examples: The mountain torrent swept away everything in its path
Spring melts turned the creek into a dangerous torrent
She downloaded the file using a torrent client application
A torrent of complaints flooded the customer service department

definitions: action of twisting or state of being twisted especially of one end relative to the other
examples: The bridge failed due to excessive torsion during the earthquake
Torsion springs store mechanical energy when twisted around their axis

definitions: human body excluding the head, neck, arms, and legs
sculpture of a human trunk, especially without head or limbs
examples: The athlete's muscular torso showed years of training dedication
X-rays revealed injuries throughout his torso and abdomen
The museum displayed an ancient Greek torso in marble
The sculptor deliberately created a torso without adding limbs

definitions: wrongful act or infringement of rights leading to civil legal liability
examples: The lawyer filed a tort claim for personal injury damages
Negligence constitutes a tort under common law legal systems

definitions: thin flat round bread made from corn or wheat flour in Mexican cuisine
examples: She wrapped the beans and rice in a warm tortilla
Fresh corn tortillas taste better than store-bought wheat ones

definitions: slow-moving land reptile with a protective shell into which it can retract
examples: The giant tortoise can live for over one hundred years
Children watched the tortoise slowly cross the garden path yesterday

definitions: mottled yellow and brown shell of certain turtles used for decorative items
domestic cat with coat coloring of mixed orange, black, and cream patches
examples: Antique tortoiseshell combs are now protected under wildlife laws
The glasses had expensive frames made from genuine tortoiseshell
Our tortoiseshell cat has distinctive orange and black markings
Female tortoiseshell cats outnumber males by thousands to one

definitions: deliberate infliction of severe physical or psychological pain as punishment or coercion
state of great physical or mental suffering and anguish
examples: International law prohibits torture under all circumstances without exception
The prisoner endured torture but refused to reveal any information
Waiting for the test results was absolute torture for her
The toothache was torture until she got emergency dental treatment

definitions: ongoing action of deliberately causing severe physical or mental pain to someone
examples: The report documented systematic torturing of political prisoners
Torturing animals is illegal and considered a serious crime

definitions: foolish or worthless talk, ideas, or writing considered as nonsense
examples: Don't believe that story, it's complete tosh
The critic dismissed the theory as absolute tosh

definitions: very young child who has recently learned to walk
small amount of alcoholic drink, especially spirits
examples: The tots played happily in the nursery playground together
She enrolled her tot in swimming lessons last month
He poured himself a tot of whisky before dinner
The sailor received his daily tot of rum

definitions: whole amount or number when everything is added together or counted
examples: The total came to exactly five hundred dollars
We need to calculate the total before submitting the invoice

definitions: system for betting on races where all bets are pooled and winners share the total
examples: The totalisator calculated the odds based on all bets placed
Modern totalisator systems use computers to track wagers instantly

definitions: person who advocates or practices a system of complete political control over all aspects of life
examples: The totalitarian imposed strict controls on all media outlets
History shows totalitarians often rise during times of crisis

definitions: system of government requiring complete subservience to the state with no opposition permitted
examples: Totalitarianism crushes individual freedom and democratic institutions completely
The twentieth century witnessed the rise of totalitarianism worldwide

definitions: whole of something being considered as a complete integrated unit
examples: We must consider the totality of evidence before deciding
The totality of her work spans five remarkable decades

definitions: large bag with parallel handles for carrying personal items or shopping
examples: She carried her laptop in a canvas tote bag
The beach tote held towels, sunscreen, and snacks

definitions: natural object or animal believed to have spiritual significance serving as emblem of group
examples: The eagle served as their clan's totem for generations
Northwest Coast tribes carved elaborate totem poles from cedar

definitions: tropical American bird with bright plumage and a distinctive large colorful bill
examples: The toucan's enormous bill helps it reach fruit on branches
Toucans inhabit the rainforest canopy throughout Central America

definitions: act of putting hand or finger on something to feel it
small amount or trace of something added or present
distinctive manner or method of dealing with something
examples: The gentle touch of her hand was reassuring
One touch activated the smartphone's screen immediately
Add just a touch of salt to enhance flavor
There was a touch of frost on the morning grass
The decorator's touch transformed the plain room beautifully
Her touch with difficult students was remarkably effective

definitions: play in American football where the ball becomes dead behind the goal line after a kick
examples: The punt resulted in a touchback at the twenty-yard line
Kicking it through the end zone creates an automatic touchback

definitions: scoring play in American football worth six points when ball crosses goal line
moment when an aircraft's wheels make contact with the runway during landing
examples: The quarterback threw a perfect pass for the winning touchdown
They scored three touchdowns in the fourth quarter alone
The pilot announced touchdown would occur in approximately ten minutes
The smooth touchdown impressed all the nervous passengers aboard

definitions: act of making physical contact with something using hands or body
examples: Touching the museum exhibits is strictly prohibited for preservation
The doctor began touching different areas to locate pain

definitions: boundary line on either of the longer sides of a soccer or rugby field
examples: The coach paced nervously along the touchline during overtime
The ball went out of play over the touchline

definitions: electronic display screen that responds to touch allowing direct interaction with displayed content
examples: The touchscreen made navigating the menu incredibly intuitive
Modern smartphones rely entirely on touchscreen technology for input

definitions: standard or criterion by which something is judged, evaluated, or recognized
examples: Shakespeare's works remain the touchstone of English literature excellence
Customer satisfaction became their touchstone for measuring business success

definitions: person who is strong, resilient, and able to endure difficult conditions
examples: The old tough survived countless challenges throughout his life
She proved herself a real tough during the grueling competition

definitions: journey for pleasure visiting several places in sequence
series of performances or matches in different locations
examples: The guided tour included all major historical sites downtown
They booked a tour of Italian vineyards next summer
The band's world tour spans fifty cities over six months
The cricket team's tour of Australia begins in December

definitions: car or motorcycle designed for comfortable long-distance travel and touring
examples: The luxury tourer had heated seats and cruise control
They bought a tourer specifically for their cross-country trip

definitions: commercial organization and operation of vacations and visits to places of interest
examples: Tourism generates billions in revenue for the local economy
Sustainable tourism helps preserve natural and cultural heritage sites

definitions: person who travels to and visits places for pleasure and interest
examples: Tourists filled the museum during the summer vacation season
The tourist asked locals for restaurant recommendations downtown

definitions: crystalline mineral occurring in various colors used as a semi-precious gemstone
examples: The pink tourmaline ring sparkled in the jewelry display
Black tourmaline is believed to have protective properties

definitions: series of contests between multiple competitors to determine an overall winner
examples: The chess tournament attracted players from twenty different countries
She won the tennis tournament without dropping a single set

definitions: tournament or series of contests, especially in medieval times or modern sports
examples: Knights gathered for the annual tourney at the castle
The basketball tourney features sixteen collegiate teams competing

definitions: device for stopping blood flow through a vein or artery by compressing a limb
examples: The paramedic quickly applied a tourniquet above the wound
Proper tourniquet use can save lives in emergency situations

definitions: person who sells tickets unofficially at inflated prices
person who gives tips on racehorses or solicits customers aggressively
examples: Touts outside the stadium offered tickets at triple price
The tout tried selling counterfeit tickets to tourists
The racing tout claimed inside knowledge about winning horses
Street touts pestered tourists with offers of guided tours

definitions: act of pulling vehicle or boat using rope or chain
coarse broken fibers of flax, hemp, or jute used for stuffing
examples: The broken car needed a tow to the repair shop
The boat provided a tow for the disabled yacht
The mattress was stuffed with tow for economical padding
Workers used tow to clean machinery in the factory

definitions: piece of absorbent cloth or paper used for drying or wiping
examples: She wrapped herself in a warm towel after showering
Paper towels quickly absorbed the spilled coffee

definitions: tall narrow building or structure, typically taller than its diameter
vertical computer case housing the main components of a desktop system
examples: The bell tower rises two hundred feet above the church
The control tower directed all airport traffic safely
The gaming tower has excellent cooling and cable management
She upgraded the graphics card in her computer tower

definitions: urban area with defined boundaries that is larger than village but smaller than city
examples: The small town had just one main street downtown
Everyone in town knew about the upcoming festival

definitions: person who lives in a town, especially contrasted with rural residents
examples: The towner rarely ventured beyond the city limits
Local towners gathered at the community center every Friday

definitions: people living in a particular town considered collectively as a group
examples: The townsfolk gathered to discuss the proposed development project
Local townsfolk preserve traditions passed down through generations

definitions: division of a county with some corporate powers of local government
urban living area in South Africa historically designated for non-white residents
examples: The township committee approved new zoning regulations last night
Several townships merged to form the new municipality
Many townships still lack basic infrastructure despite recent improvements
The artist grew up in a township outside Johannesburg

definitions: path beside a canal or river originally used by horses towing boats
examples: Cyclists enjoy riding along the restored canal towpath
The towpath provides scenic walking routes through the countryside

definitions: degree to which a substance can damage an organism or environment
examples: Scientists tested the toxicity of the new chemical compound
The drug's toxicity limits its therapeutic dosage significantly

definitions: branch of science concerned with the nature, effects, and detection of poisons
examples: The toxicology report revealed the cause of death
She studied toxicology to work in forensic investigation

definitions: poisonous substance produced within living cells or organisms causing disease
examples: The bacteria releases a powerful toxin into the bloodstream
Environmental toxins accumulate in the food chain over time

definitions: object for children to play with, typically a model or miniature replica
something treated casually or without serious regard
examples: The child's favorite toy was a stuffed teddy bear
Educational toys help develop cognitive and motor skills
The yacht was merely a toy for the billionaire
Don't toy with dangerous equipment without proper training
